name: methyl_4-phenylbenzoate
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: 4-phenylbenzoate has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure and raises the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius. The phenyl group, on the other hand, increases the melting point due to its ability to participate in hydrogen bonding and form a more rigid structure, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius.
